trans-unit.source:
\n

Provides information about a specific culture (called a locale for unmanaged code development).
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx x xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx $xxxxxx x xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source: The information includes the names for the culture, the writing system, the calendar used, the sort order of strings, and formatting for dates and numbers.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx$ xxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\nname is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\nname is not a valid culture name.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxx$$xx$ xx xxx x xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the Notes to Callers section.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxxx$ xxx xxx Xxxxx xx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the default calendar used by the culture.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

An object that represents the culture used by the current thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The property is set to null.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The culture used by the Resource Manager to look up culture-specific resources at run time.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx Xxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx xx xxxx xx xxxxxxx$xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The property is set to null.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The property is set to a culture name that cannot be used to locate a resource file.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx x xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxxx xx xxxxxx x xxxxxxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source: Resource filenames can include only letters, numbers, hyphens, or underscores.
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The property is set to null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the default culture for threads in the current application domain.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The default culture for threads in the current application domain, or null if the current system culture is the default thread culture in the application domain.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the default UI culture for threads in the current application domain.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx XX xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The default UI culture for threads in the current application domain, or null if the current system UI culture is the default thread UI culture in the application domain.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx XX xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx XX xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx XX xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the full localized culture name.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The full localized culture name in the format languagefull [country/regionfull], where languagefull is the full name of the language and country/regionfull is the full name of the country/region.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx $xxxxxxx$xxxxxxxxxx$$ xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the culture name in the format languagefull [country/regionfull] in English.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx $xxxxxxx$xxxxxxxxxx$ xx Xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The culture name in the format languagefull [country/regionfull] in English, where languagefull is the full name of the language and country/regionfull is the full name of the country/region.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx $xxxxxxx$xxxxxxxxxx$ xx Xxxxxxx$ xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The object that is culture-independent (invariant).

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx$xxxxxxxxxxx $xxxxxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the culture name in the format languagecode2-country/regioncode2.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx0$xxxxxxx$xxxxxxxxxx0.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The culture name in the format languagecode2-country/regioncode2.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx0$xxxxxxx$xxxxxxxxxx0.

trans-unit.source: languagecode2 is a lowercase two-letter code derived from ISO 639-1.
trans-unit.target: xxxxxxxxxxxx0 xx x xxxxxxxxx xxx$xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx XXX 000$0.

trans-unit.source: country/regioncode2 is derived from ISO 3166 and usually consists of two uppercase letters, or a BCP-47 language tag.
trans-unit.target: xxxxxxx$xxxxxxxxxx0 xx xxxxxxx xxxx XXX 0000 xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xx x XXX$00 xxxxxxxx xxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the culture name, consisting of the language, the country/region, and the optional script, that the culture is set to display.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx$ xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxx$xxxxxx$ xxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The property is set to null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the list of calendars that can be used by the culture.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets an object that defines how to format the specified type.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

\nci is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xx$$xx$ xx xxxx.
